meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Get ready for a groovy review that's sure to make you giggle!

I'm diving into the mystical world of Cryptmaster, a game that's got everyone talking - or should I say, typing away? With its unique blend of vocabulary-based gameplay and old-school RPG elements, this indie gem has caught the attention of even the most seasoned critics. But let's be real, what really sets it apart is its wicked sense of humor!

I mean, have you ever seen a game where you get to hang out with a crypt-keeper dude who's more chill than a hippie at Woodstock? Or one that lets you solve puzzles by typing out spooky stories like a crypt-idiot (ahem, I mean, expert)? It's like someone poured a can of awesomesauce all over the standard RPG formula and said, "Hey, let's get this party started!"

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Is it just me, or does this game sound like a bunch of hooey?" But trust me, folks, Cryptmaster is the real deal! The visuals are top-notch (I mean, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned black-and-white pencil sketch?), and the writing is clever enough to keep you hooked.

Of course, no game is perfect, and Cryptmaster has its quirks. Some critics have complained about the combat being a bit of a slog (yawn), but I think that's just part of the charm - it's like trying to solve a puzzle while simultaneously solving another one!

In the end, Cryptmaster is a refreshing change of pace from your run-of-the-mill dungeon crawlers. If you're looking for something new and exciting to sink your teeth into (or should I say, type away?), look no further! So grab some popcorn, get comfy, and prepare for a wild ride that'll keep you laughing and guessing until the very end.

P.S. Don't @ me, Slant Magazine - I know you said it's "frustrating," but come on, who doesn't love a good challenge every now and then?
